name: gold-silver mine operation with refinery | gold | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11743/documentation

This dataset describes the production of gold and silver in Quebec (Canada) in 2012. This includes the operations at the mining site located in Quebec, i.e. mining, benefication and a first refining, which leads to the production of doré bars, containing gold, silver and impurities. ;Specific data were collected from 3 mines that produced doré bars in Quebec. These mines represent about 98% of Quebec gold production and about 95% of Quebec silver production from combined gold-silver mines. Share is estimated as the production statistics for 2012-2013 are not published yet and considers gold-silver mines only (not gold and silver coming from other mines). One mine is an open-pit mine and the two others are underground. A weighted average of 839 tonnes of ore is extracted per kg of gold produce. The recovery rate of gold is known for two of the mines (89% and 91%) and the recovery rate of silver known for only one mine (76%). ;Note that the mine infrastructure are extrapolated from gold-silver mine operation with refinery, GLO dataset, where the modelled mines are open pit. This is not representative of the Quebec situation where two of the three modelled mine are underground. Thus a mine infrastrucuture, gold and silver, Québec will eventually be created in order to reflect the Québec specificity. ;In order to create a dataset with gold and silver as outputs (to comply with the boundaries of the GLO dataset), a very simplified modeling of the refining of the doré bars to produce gold and silver has been added to this dataset although it is done in Ontario (Canada) : electricity use is extrapolated from gold-silver mine operation with refinery, PE and PG datasets and infrastructure extrapolated from gold-silver mine operation with refinery, GLO dataset. ;It is assume that the refining efficency is 100% (i.e. no loss of gold).

From metal containing ore extraction from the ground.

This activity ends with the refining of gold and silver.

This dataset includes the operation at the mining site located in Quebec (Canada), i.e. mining, benefication and a first refining, which leads to the production of doré bars. The refining of the doré bars to produce gold and silver, occuring in Ontario (Canada) is also included in this dataset.  
Energy and material use, water and air emissions, infrastructure and land use are included for the operation at the mine site and only electricity and infrastructures are included for the refining of the doré bars. 

This dataset doesn"t include:
- Fine charcoal (byproduct): fine charcoal coal that no longer meets specifications to enter the process is sent to a smelter to recover gold. Excluded because available data are not complete and reliable.
- Waste sent to recycling: Paper, cardboard (1.028E1 kg/kg) and wood, metals, paper, oil (1.853E1 kg/kg).

Note that the emissions to air and water are limited to what has been measured on site. Also, anodes and cathodes for doré bar refining are supposed to be included in refinery infrastructure.

All calculations made can not be documented (using paramaters, properties and equation) for confidentiality reasons.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/07:Mining of metal ores/072:Mining of non-ferrous metal ores/0729:Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Collected data for Quebec industry for the years 2012 and 2013 : two mines provided 2012 data and one mine provided 2013 data (partly extrapolated as the year was not yet completed).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Inputs and outputs for mining, benefication and a first refining relate to Quebec production. Inputs for doré bar refining, which is done in Ontario, are extrapolated from dataset gold-silver mine operation with refinery (PG, CL, SE).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: One of the modelled mine is an open-pit mine and the two others are underground.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
Extrapolations have been made for: 
- The refining of the doré bars based on ecoinvent datasets for electricity consumption and infrastructures.   
- Recovery rate of silver known for only one mine and supposed equivalent for all three mines.
- Recovery rate of gold known for two mines and assumed equal to the average of the two mines for the third mine.  
- The chemicals used for wastewater treatment are known for the 2 smaller mines (different inputs) and extrapolated for the third mine.
- Emissions to water: some emissions were given by one mine and extrapolated to the other 2 mines and other emissions were given by two mines and extrapolated to the third one. 
- Emissions to air extrapolated from 1 mine to the other two, based on gold production.
- Waste were given by two mines and extrapolated to the third one.
- Mine insfrastructure extrapolated from gold-silver mine operation with refinery, GLO dataset.
The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Specific data were collected from 3 mines located in Quebec for mining, benefication and a first refining. Extrapolation based on ecoinvent datasets was done for the refining of the doré bars.

exchanges.description:
The gold comes from three different ores with the following compositions:
0.209 kg Au: 6.8 ppm Au and 1.5 ppm Ag in ore	
0.1538 kg Au: 5.4 ppm Au and 0.15 ppm Ag in ore	
0.7561 kg Au: 0.97 ppm Au and 0.76 ppm Ag in ore	

The input amount of 0.1538 kg of gold was calculated based on the recovered gold for this mine and the recovery rate of the two other mines (not known for this mine).
The other two input amounts were calculated based on the gold concentration in the ore and the amount of ore extracted.

flow.name: Gold
flow.category: Elementary flows/Resource/in ground

exchanges.description:
Calculated Value based on weighted average from 1 mine (information was not available for the 2 other mines).
Raw data gives the amount of anti-freeze. It is assume that 60% ethylene glycol solution (% by volume), as its freezing point is -55 C (neglect water as it is marginal compared to the global amount of water consumed on site).

exchanges.description:
Calculated Value. The refining of the doré bars to produce gold and silver, occuring in Ontario (Canada), has been added to this dataset in order to comply with the boundaries of the GLO dataset (vertical aggregation). Elctricity used has been modelled in a very simplified way. See exchange properties for details.
Electricity consumption should be allocated on the basis of the amount used for gold and silver.

exchanges.description:
The silver comes from three different ores with the following compositions:
0.5924 kg Ag: 0.76 ppm Ag and 0.97 ppm Au in ore	
0.0043 kg Ag: 0.15 ppm Ag and 5.4 ppm Au in ore	
0.0469 kg Ag: 1.5 ppm Ag and 6.8 ppm Au in ore	

The input amount of 0.5924 kg of silver was calculated based on the silver concentration in ore and amount of ore extracted.
The other two amounts were calculated based on the recovered silver for this mine and the recovery rate of another mine (recovery rate known for only one of the mine and supposed equivalent for all three mines).
